About the Campaign

Giant pandas are no longer endangered, but they remain vulnerable with only about 1,800 left in the wild. Your contribution helps:

  • Protect and expand panda habitats
  • Support breeding and research programs
  • Fund anti-poaching patrols
  • Educate local communities

How Your Contribution Helps
Habitat Protection

Your funds help protect and expand bamboo forests, the primary habitat of giant pandas.

Research Programs

Support scientific studies to better understand panda behavior and preservation needs.

Breeding Programs

Fund breeding centers that help increase the panda population through careful genetic management.

Community Education

Support programs that teach local communities about sustainable practices that protect pandas.
